intro: Fimbristylis perlaxa, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Australia and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along waterways. Fimbristylis perlaxa is often found in dense stands and can form an important part of the vegetation in wetland ecosystems.
